titleStmt.title: Letter, Jos W. Allen in New Orleans, La., to David Burford in Dixon Springs, Smith County, Tenn., 1859 March 14

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, Jos W. Allen in New Orleans, La., to David Burford in Dixon Springs, Smith County, Tenn., 1859 March 14

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Col Johnson wrote me a few weeks ago that he wished to quit the Bank of Tennessee and wanted me to accept the Presidency. I replied to him that I could not do so, he requested me to suggest someone. I have not done so as yet, but wish to place your name before him if you will consent, and I shall await your answer before saying anything to him on the subject.

You intimated when I saw you last that you would like to move to Nashville - with a good cashier, you would have an easy time of it in the Bank and could retain it as long as you wished. Please consider this strictly private. My family are all well.
